bugs.description: Typo in property name 'crossorgin' should be 'crossorigin' on line 48. This will cause the crossorigin link functionality to never work as intended since the condition will always be false.

Incorrect parameter order in addEventListener calls on lines 77 and 83. The 'on' function calls window.addEventListener(el, type) but it should be window.addEventListener(type, el) since 'el' is the handler function when isFn(type) is true. Same issue in 'off' function.

String concatenation bug on line 47. When attrs.length is 0, the code tries to concatenate a string with an array (attrs), which will result in incorrect HTML output like 'alt="text"' instead of 'alt="text"'. Should be an empty string or proper spacing.

Incorrect renderer method assignment on line 5. The function assigns to 'renderer.code' but this should be 'renderer.heading' based on the function name 'headingCompiler' and the HTML output which generates heading tags.

Potential null pointer exception on lines 263-267. The code calls removeChild() on nodes without checking if they exist first. If querySelector returns null, calling parentNode.removeChild(node) will throw an error.
Typo in property name 'crossorgin' should be 'crossorigin' on line 48. This will cause the crossorigin link functionality to never work as intended since the condition will always be false.

Incorrect parameter order in addEventListener calls on lines 77 and 83. The 'on' function calls window.addEventListener(el, type) but it should be window.addEventListener(type, el) since 'el' is the handler function when isFn(type) is true. Same issue in 'off' function.

String concatenation bug on line 47. When attrs.length is 0, the code tries to concatenate a string with an array (attrs), which will result in incorrect HTML output like 'alt="text"' instead of 'alt="text"'. Should be an empty string or proper spacing.

Incorrect renderer method assignment on line 5. The function assigns to 'renderer.code' but this should be 'renderer.heading' based on the function name 'headingCompiler' and the HTML output which generates heading tags.

Potential null pointer exception on lines 263-267. The code calls removeChild() on nodes without checking if they exist first. If querySelector returns null, calling parentNode.removeChild(node) will throw an error.

In the headline.js file, the function is incorrectly assigning to `renderer.code` instead of `renderer.heading`. This will overwrite the code renderer and the heading renderer will never be set, causing incorrect rendering behavior.

In the image.js file, line 47 has a bug where attrs is used as a string instead of being joined. When attrs.length > 0 is false, the code tries to concatenate an array directly to a string, which will result in incorrect HTML output like img src=... alt=...Array instead of proper attributes.

In the link.js file, line 48 has a typo in the property name 'crossorgin' which should be 'crossorigin'. This will cause the crossorigin functionality to never work properly since the condition will always be false.

In the lifecycle.js file, there is a potential null pointer exception on line 31. The code accesses this._hooks[hookName] without checking if this._hooks exists or if the hookName exists in _hooks. If callHook is called before initLifecycle or with an invalid hookName, this will throw an exception.

In the render/index.js file, lines 261-263 have a potential null pointer exception. The code calls node.parentNode.removeChild(node) without checking if node.parentNode exists. If the node is not attached to the DOM or has already been removed, this will throw an exception.

In the compiler.js file, line 286 has a complex loop manipulation that can cause an infinite loop or incorrect array iteration. The expression toc.splice and j-- and i++ modifies both j and i counters within the loop, and since splice removes an element, the loop condition may not work as expected, potentially causing elements to be skipped or the loop to run indefinitely.

In the embed.js file, line 42 accesses the global variable $docsify without checking if it exists. If $docsify is not defined in the global scope, this will throw a ReferenceError and crash the application.
